Miles Sound System SDK 6.1c

AIL_set_named_sample_file

The function AIL_set_named_sample_file initializes a sample's address, length, type, and flags to prepare for playback of a memory-resident .

S32 AIL_set_named_sample_file(
  HSAMPLE S,
  char const * filename_ext,
  void const * file_image,
  S32 file_size,
  S32 block
);

In Parameters

S
indicates the sample to prepare for file playback.
filename_ext
is a filename who's extension determines what ASI decoder to use. For example, to use the MPEG Layer 3 decoder, you would specify ".mp3" (or any string with ".mp3" in it). Future decoders will have their own extensions.
file_image
points to the start of the file image in memory.
file_size
specifies the size of the file image.
block
specifies a block number to play in the file. block is ignored with formats for which MSS does not support multiple blocks, such as the .WAV format.

Returns

0 if the file could not be parsed or if the desired block was not found; otherwise, a non-zero return value indicates the sample handle was successfully prepared for file playback.

Discussion

VOC file, uncompressed .WAV file, IMA ADPCM compressed .WAV file, MPEG Layer 3 file, or any other supported ASI compressed file.

This function is very similar to both AIL_allocate_file_sample and AIL_set_sample_file, except that it requires a filename extension to figure out what decoder to use.

It is not necessary to call AIL_set_sample_type, AIL_set_sample_playback_rate, or AIL_set_sample_address when using this function. However, the sample handle passed to AIL_set_named_sample_file must first have been initialized with a call to AIL_init_sample.
